sentences: Co-Chair Wollansky reported that parties had considered two bracketed options, but that differences remained on forwarding bracketed text to the COP/MOP or to a later SBSTA session.
Parties adopted short draft conclusions (FCCC/SBSTA/2008/L.21) and this matter will be taken up in SBSTA 30.
The EU, SAUDI ARABIA, AUSTRALIA, NORWAY and JAPAN expressed regret that agreement had not been reached.
JAMAICA noted that CCS technology is not ready for use in an offset mechanism such as the CDM.
BRAZIL highlighted concerns relating to long-term permanence and host-country liabilities.
